gcci.text: At $3.23/hr for H100s, chip scarcity is forcing hyperscalers to lock in longer-term contracts and diversify suppliers, raising capex as availability trumps marginal cost.

gtpi.text: With an average input price of $1.25 per million tokens, API price wars are pushing providers to optimize inference via caching and quantization to defend margins.

gagl.text: A 120 TWh annual AI load (~13.7 GW average) is straining grids, accelerating nuclear and long‑duration storage adoption to meet reliability and carbon goals.

aipi.text: Rising capex, falling API prices, and surging energy demand create cautious optimism, but the sector must manage bubble risk through disciplined scaling and energy‑efficient architectures.
